intro: Psychotria trichoneura, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It produces small, round berries that are usually green when immature and turn red when mature. Psychotria trichoneura is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich, moist soils.
